52.eng-name: Characteristics of the Day of Judgment, Paradise, and Hell

hadiths.text: Ka'b reported that Allah's Messenger (ﷺ) said that the similitude of a believer is that of a standing crop in a field which is shaken by wind and then it comes to its original position but it stands at its roots. The similitude of a non-believer is that of a cypress tree which stands on its roots and nothing shakes it but it is uprooted (with) one (violent stroke)

chapter.ara-name: باب مَثَلُ الْمُؤْمِنِ كَالزَّرْعِ وَمَثَلُ الْكَافِرِ كَشَجَرِ الأَرْزِ
chapter.eng-name: The Believer Is Like A Plant And The Hypocrite And The Disbeliever Are Like Cedars
